segment.source: How to fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: How to fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Fix intranet search problems with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: After upgrading to Internet Explorer 11, you might experience search issues while using your intranet site.
segment.target: After upgrading to Internet Explorer 11, you might experience search issues while using your intranet site.

segment.source: Why is my intranet redirecting me to search results?
segment.target: Why is my intranet redirecting me to search results?

segment.source: IE11 works differently with search, based on whether your organization is domain-joined.
segment.target: IE11 works differently with search, based on whether your organization is domain-joined.

segment.source: Domain-joined computers.
segment.target: Domain-joined computers.

segment.source: A single word entry is treated as a search term.
segment.target: A single word entry is treated as a search term.

segment.source: However, IE11 also checks for available intranet sites and offers matches through the Notification bar.
segment.target: However, IE11 also checks for available intranet sites and offers matches through the Notification bar.

segment.source: If you select Yes from the Notification bar to navigate to the intranet site, IE11 associates that word with the site so that the next time you type in the intranet site name, inline auto-complete will resolve to the intranet site address.
segment.target: If you select Yes from the Notification bar to navigate to the intranet site, IE11 associates that word with the site so that the next time you type in the intranet site name, inline auto-complete will resolve to the intranet site address.

segment.source: Non-domain-joined computers.
segment.target: Non-domain-joined computers.

segment.source: A single word entry is treated as an intranet site.
segment.target: A single word entry is treated as an intranet site.

segment.source: However, if the term doesn't resolve to a site, IE11 then treats the entry as a search term and opens your default search provider.
segment.target: However, if the term doesn't resolve to a site, IE11 then treats the entry as a search term and opens your default search provider.

segment.source: To explicitly go to an intranet site, regardless of the environment, users can type either a trailing slash like or the prefix.
segment.target: To explicitly go to an intranet site, regardless of the environment, users can type either a trailing slash like or the prefix.

segment.source: Either of these will cause IE11 to treat the entry as an intranet search.
segment.target: Either of these will cause IE11 to treat the entry as an intranet search.

segment.source: You can also change the default behavior so that IE11 treats your single word entry in the address bar as an intranet site, regardless of your environment.
segment.target: You can also change the default behavior so that IE11 treats your single word entry in the address bar as an intranet site, regardless of your environment.

segment.source: To enable single-word intranet search
segment.target: To enable single-word intranet search

segment.source: Open Internet Explorer for the desktop, click the Tools menu, and then click Internet Options.
segment.target: Open Internet Explorer for the desktop, click the Tools menu, and then click Internet Options.

segment.source: Click Advanced, check the Go to an intranet site for a single word entry in the Address bar box, and then click OK.
segment.target: Click Advanced, check the Go to an intranet site for a single word entry in the Address bar box, and then click OK.

segment.source: If you'd like your entire organization to have single word entries default to an intranet site, you can turn on the Go to an intranet site for a single word entry in the Address bar Group Policy.
segment.target: If you'd like your entire organization to have single word entries default to an intranet site, you can turn on the Go to an intranet site for a single word entry in the Address bar Group Policy.

segment.source: With this policy turned on, a search for automatically resolves to .
segment.target: With this policy turned on, a search for automatically resolves to .
